title: 104_hr1496
content: The Act titled "Prostate Cancer Diagnosis and Treatment Act of 1995" allows Medicare coverage for prostate cancer screening and certain drug treatments. The "Prostate Cancer Diagnosis and Treatment Act of 1995" enables Medicare coverage for prostate cancer screening services for early detection. "Services for early detection of prostate cancer are covered by Medicare under the Prostate Cancer Diagnosis and Treatment Act of 1995." The Prostate Cancer Diagnosis and Treatment Act of 1995 covers services for the early detection of prostate cancer, including digital rectal examination, prostate-specific antigen blood test, transrectal ultrasonography, and other designated procedures. Payment amounts and frequency limits for these services are specified in the Act. Payment for services for early detection of prostate cancer is limited to the frequency allowed and is 80% of the actual charge or the fee schedule amount for specific tests. The text discusses amending the United States Code to include tests for early detection and diagnosis of prostate cancer, as well as coverage for services related to prostate cancer detection and treatment for veterans. The Secretary shall implement a schedule for early detection of prostate cancer for veterans confined to hospitals or other institutions, including procedures like digital rectal examinations, PSA blood tests, and transrectal ultrasonography.
